MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed
abstract member Dispose : unit -> unit override this.Dispose : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader>. The `Dispose` method leaves the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader> in an unusable state. After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader> was occupying.
For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
> [!NOTE] > Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader>. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader> object's `Finalize` method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub Dispose (disposing As Boolean)
abstract member Dispose : bool -> unit override this.Dispose : bool -> unit

Docs.param: to release managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the managed resources used by the and optionally releases the unmanaged resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method calls <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReader.Close%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator

Docs.summary: Returns an that can be used to iterate through the rows in the data reader.
Docs.returns: An that can be used to iterate through the rows in the data reader.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although you can use this method to retrieve an explicit constructor, in languages that support an explicit **foreach** construct, it is simpler to use the looping construct directly in order to iterate through the rows in the data reader.
If you implement this method, it should return a new instance of <xref:System.Data.Common.DbEnumerator> or ensure that your enumerator returns <xref:System.Data.IDataRecord> objects.

For more information, see [SqlClient Streaming Support](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sqlclient-streaming-support.md).

The connection drops or is closed during the data retrieval.
-or-
The is closed during the data retrieval.
-or-

-or-

The returned type was not one of the following types: binary, image, varbinary, or udt.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool> NextResultAsync(valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

abstract member NextResultAsync : System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<bool> override this.NextResultAsync : System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<bool>

Docs.summary:
This is the asynchronous version of . Providers should override with an appropriate implementation. The may optionally be ignored.
The default implementation invokes the synchronous method and returns a completed task, blocking the calling thread. The default implementation will return a cancelled task if passed an already cancelled . Exceptions thrown by will be communicated via the returned Task Exception property.
Other methods and properties of the DbDataReader object should not be invoked while the returned Task is not yet completed.
Docs.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about asynchronous programming, see [Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md).

Docs.exception: An error occurred while executing the command text.

Public MustOverride Function Read () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Advances the reader to the next record in a result set.
Docs.returns: if there are more rows; otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default position of a data reader is before the first record. Therefore, you must call <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader.Read%2A> to begin accessing data.

Docs.summary: Implements the asynchronous version of , but returns a Task synchronously, blocking the calling thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about asynchronous programming, see [Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool> ReadAsync() cil managed
Public Function ReadAsync () As Task(Of Boolean)

Docs.summary: An asynchronous version of , which advances the reader to the next record in a result set. This method invokes with CancellationToken.None.
Docs.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about asynchronous programming, see [Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md).

Docs.exception: An error occurred while executing the command text.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool> ReadAsync(valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
abstract member ReadAsync : System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<bool> override this.ReadAsync : System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<bool>

Docs.summary:
This is the asynchronous version of . Providers should override with an appropriate implementation. The cancellationToken may optionally be ignored.
The default implementation invokes the synchronous method and returns a completed task, blocking the calling thread. The default implementation will return a cancelled task if passed an already cancelled cancellationToken. Exceptions thrown by Read will be communicated via the returned Task Exception property.
Do not invoke other methods and properties of the object until the returned Task is complete.
Docs.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about asynchronous programming, see [Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md).

Docs.exception: An error occurred while executing the command text.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property RecordsAffected As Integer
public: abstract property int RecordsAffected { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted by execution of the SQL statement.
Docs.value: The number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted. -1 for SELECT statements; 0 if no rows were affected or the statement failed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `RecordsAffected` property is not set until all rows are read and you close the `DataReader`.

block.para: This property and should be implemented to return a value when the reader is closed.

Docs.returns: An instance of to be used when the field points to more remote structured data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Data.IDataRecord> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property VisibleFieldCount As Integer
public: virtual property int VisibleFieldCount { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of fields in the that are not hidden.
Docs.value: The number of fields that are not hidden.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value is used to determine how many fields in the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataReader> are visible. For example, a SELECT on a partial primary key returns the remaining parts of the key as hidden fields. The hidden fields are always appended behind the visible fields.
